definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: This camera with a magic eye costs much more than that automat.
sentences.chinese: 这架装有电眼的照相机比那台自动的要贵得多。

sentences.english: The magic eye can control the gluing system in case of break feeding.
sentences.chinese: 电眼控制断纸胶水的空印等。

sentences.english: You always fall in love with women with beautiful eyes!
sentences.chinese: 你老是对电眼美女一见钟情。

sentences.english: This camera is equipped with a magic eye.
sentences.chinese: 这架照相讥装有一只电眼。

sentences.english: Installment electric eye tracing causes to print design of position the bag to be precise.
sentences.chinese: 装置电眼追踪使印刷袋之图案位置精确。

sentences.english: Coverter speed regulator adjusts without grades with automatically following of German Si Electric Eye.
sentences.chinese: 变频调速无级调整，德国施克电眼自动跟踪。

sentences.english: Precision pellet count with special electrical eye protection device.
sentences.chinese: 特殊电眼保护装置，可确保数粒准确。

sentences.english: Remarks: suggest to use with Edge Sensor Device.
sentences.chinese: 建议搭配电眼检知之功能装置功能使用。

definition: eyes bright and full of expression
red phoenix eyes (eyes whose outer corners incline upwards)
lit. cherry mouth (idiom)/fig. a delicate, ruby-lipped mouth
expression or emotion showing in one's eyes/meaningful glance/wink/eyesight (dialect)
plump lower eyelids (considered to be an attractive feature)
